div.head: Richard Harrison Will
div.p:
The last will and testament of Richard Harrison in the year of
our Lord God 1676/7.
first- I bequeath my soule to God the othe and giver of all things

second my body to the ground from where it came the Lord giveth and
to Lord taketh blessed be name of the Lord.

Thirdly being in perfect health and memory I bequeath all my wordly wealth as
moveable and unmoveable as Lands goods Chattles and all other things
appertaining unto me unto my dearly beloved wife Elizabeth Harrison
during her life time.

forthly after he decease. I bequeath my Land unto my loving Susane
Harrison and her heirs forever

adter the deseas of my Loving wife I bequeath all moveables whatsoever
unto me are belonging unto my son Richard and Thomas to be equally
divided between them

fifthly I gve that if my Daughter Susane should die without heirs thatt her
two younger brothers Richard and Thomas should inherit the Land unto
her appointed.

sixthly I bequeath unto my son John Burges before me deseas the best cow calf I have
I have now living and likewise the next mare foul that falls and soe to
the recorded for him as witness my hand and seal the day and year above
written.

Signed and sealed
In the presence of us
Henry Henly
Nicholas Chapman
Charles ounty Js.
his
Richard Harrison
mark
April 7th 1677.

Then come before me under written one of his lordopife Justice for Charles
County Henry Henly and made oath that he saw Richard Harrison sign
seal and publish this to be his last will and testament the other witness
being Deade.
2 3/4 sides
John Dougles
